test_cases.name: Create Formula-Based Metric with Weekly Cadence and Custom Target
preconditions: A valid, active user account with the specified credentials must exist.
The user account must have access to the specified company.
The prerequisite metrics for the formula must exist in the system and be accessible to the user.
The application must be available at the specified base URL.

test_data.metric_name: Weekly Formula Metric with Custom Target

test_steps.action: Navigate to the application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's email address in the email input field and click the 'Continue' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's password in the password input field and click the 'Login' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Locate and click on the specified company from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is redirected to the company's dashboard.

test_steps.action: Verify the dashboard page is displayed after successful login.
test_steps.expected_result: The dashboard page is visible with the main navigation menu.

test_steps.action: Click on 'Metrics' in the navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The Metrics page is loaded and displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the metric name in the 'Name' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The specified metric name is entered into the field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Value Source' dropdown and select 'Formula'.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Formula Builder' interface becomes visible.

test_steps.action: Verify the 'Formula Builder' interface is visible.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'Search Metric' input field and operator buttons are displayed.

test_steps.action: Search for the first metric by name in the 'Search Metric' field and select it from the results.
test_steps.expected_result: The first metric is added to the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Click on the desired operator button (e.g., '+').
test_steps.expected_result: The operator is added to the formula display area.

test_steps.action: Search for the second metric by name in the 'Search Metric' field and select it from the results.
test_steps.expected_result: The second metric is added to the formula display area, completing the formula.

test_steps.action: Verify the complete formula is displayed correctly in the format: (Metric) [Operator] (Metric).
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is displayed as constructed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Cadence' dropdown and select 'Weekly'.
test_steps.expected_result: The cadence is set to 'Weekly' and the 'Resets On' dropdown appears.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Resets On' dropdown and select a day of the week.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected day is displayed in the 'Resets On' field.

test_steps.action: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is accepted and validated.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is saved successfully and the user is returned to the Metrics page.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the main navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Locate and click the 'Edit KPI' icon in the 'My KPIs' section.
test_steps.expected_result: The KPI management modal opens with available and selected metrics panels.

test_steps.action: Search for and locate the newly created metric in the left panel of available metrics.
test_steps.expected_result: The new metric is found and displayed in the left panel.

test_steps.action: Click the metric in the left panel.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is moved from the left panel to the right panel of selected KPIs.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes and the dashboard refreshes to show the new metric card.

test_steps.action: Identify the new metric card on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric card for the newly added metric is visible.

test_steps.action: Hover the mouse cursor over the metric card.
test_steps.expected_result: The three-dot menu button becomes visible on the card.

test_steps.action: Click the three-dot menu button.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown menu with options like 'Edit' appears.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The application navigates to the Edit page for the metric.

test_steps.action: On the Edit page, select the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration options are displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Custom' radio button.
test_steps.expected_result: Four input fields for Level 1, Level 2, Level 3, and Level 4 targets appear.

test_steps.action: Enter a numeric value for the Level 1 target.
test_steps.expected_result: The value is entered in the Level 1 field.

test_steps.action: Enter a numeric value for the Level 2 target.
test_steps.expected_result: The value is entered in the Level 2 field.

test_steps.action: Enter a numeric value for the Level 3 target.
test_steps.expected_result: The value is entered in the Level 3 field.

test_steps.action: Enter a numeric value for the Level 4 target.
test_steps.expected_result: The value is entered in the Level 4 field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration is saved and the page navigates back to the dashboard.

test_steps.action: Verify the metric card on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric card displays the custom target indicators, name, and value correctly.

test_cases.name: Create Metric from Existing Metric with Monthly Cadence and Time-Based Target
preconditions: A valid, active user account with the specified credentials must exist.
The user account must have access to the specified company.
The prerequisite metric to be selected must exist in the system and be accessible to the user.
The application must be available at the specified base URL.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the application URL.
test_steps.expected_result: The login page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's email address and click 'Continue'.
test_steps.expected_result: The password input field appears.

test_steps.action: Enter the user's password and click 'Login'.
test_steps.expected_result: The company selection page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the specified company from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The user is redirected to the company's dashboard.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Metrics page via the navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The Metrics page is loaded and displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form opens.

test_steps.action: Enter the metric name in the 'Name' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The specified metric name is entered into the field.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Value Source' dropdown and select 'Metric'.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric selection interface becomes visible.

test_steps.action: Search for and select an existing metric from the metric selection interface.
test_steps.expected_result: The selected metric is displayed as the value source.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Cadence' dropdown and select 'Monthly'.
test_steps.expected_result: The cadence is set to 'Monthly'. The 'Resets On' field does not appear.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is saved successfully.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard' from the main navigation.
test_steps.expected_result: The 'My Dashboard' page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon to open the KPI management modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The KPI management modal opens.

test_steps.action: Locate the new metric in the left panel and click it.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric moves to the right panel of selected KPIs.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes and the dashboard refreshes, showing the new metric card.

test_steps.action: Locate the correct metric card on the dashboard, hover over it, and click the three-dot menu button.
test_steps.expected_result: A dropdown menu appears.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit' option from the dropdown menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The application navigates to the Edit page for the metric.

test_steps.action: Select the 'Target' tab if it is not already active.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration options are displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Time-Based' radio button.
test_steps.expected_result: 'Start' and 'Target' input fields appear.

test_steps.action: Enter a numeric value in the 'Start' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The start value is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Enter a numeric value in the 'Target' input field.
test_steps.expected_result: The target value is entered correctly.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The target configuration is saved and the page navigates back to the dashboard.

test_steps.action: Verify the metric card on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric card displays the time-based progress indicator, name, and value correctly.

test_cases.name: Create Formula-Based Metric with Quarterly Cadence and Add to Dashboard
preconditions: A valid, active user account with the specified credentials must exist.
The user account must have access to the specified company.
The prerequisite metrics for the formula must exist in the system and be accessible to the user.
The application must be available at the specified base URL.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the application URL and log in with valid credentials.
test_steps.expected_result: The user successfully logs in and the dashboard is displayed.

test_steps.action: Select the specified company from the list.
test_steps.expected_result: The company dashboard is displayed.

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Metrics page via the navigation menu.
test_steps.expected_result: The Metrics page is loaded.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Add Metric' button.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric creation form appears.

test_steps.action: Enter a name for the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The name is entered in the 'Name' field.

test_steps.action: Select 'Formula' from the 'Value Source' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The Formula Builder interface is displayed.

test_steps.action: Search for and select the first metric for the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The first metric is added to the formula.

test_steps.action: Click on an operator button (e.g., '*').
test_steps.expected_result: The operator is added to the formula.

test_steps.action: Search for and select the second metric for the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The second metric is added, completing the formula.

test_steps.action: Select 'Quarterly' from the 'Cadence' dropdown.
test_steps.expected_result: The cadence is set to 'Quarterly'.

test_steps.action: Click the green checkmark button to confirm the formula.
test_steps.expected_result: The formula is validated.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button to create the metric.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is created successfully.

test_steps.action: Navigate to 'My Dashboard'.
test_steps.expected_result: The dashboard page is displayed.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Edit KPI' icon.
test_steps.expected_result: The KPI management modal opens.

test_steps.action: Locate the new metric in the available metrics panel and click it.
test_steps.expected_result: The metric is moved to the selected KPIs panel.

test_steps.action: Click the 'Save' button in the modal.
test_steps.expected_result: The modal closes and the dashboard refreshes.

test_steps.action: Locate the correct metric card on the dashboard.
test_steps.expected_result: The new metric card is present on the dashboard, displaying its name and current value, but without any target visualization.
